column1: # SOURCE: FAO Irrigation and Drainage Paper No. 56 (Tables 11
# DESCRIPTION: Validated crop coefficients (Kc) by growth stage for irrigation scheduling
#   in Sinai Peninsula hot arid climate. Five crops: tomato
#   - root_depth_m: Effective root depth during stage (meters)
#   - critical_depletion: Fraction of available water that can be depleted before stress (dimensionless)
# LOGIC: Kc values relate crop evapotranspiration (ETc) to reference evapotranspiration (ETo)
#   via ETc = Kc * ETo. The Kc curve has three key values: Kc_ini (initial)

column2: Kc transitions from Kc_mid to Kc_end.

column1: # DEPENDENCIES: Reference evapotranspiration (ETo) from weather data
#   - FAO-56 recommends +5% Kc_mid adjustment for arid conditions (Equation 62)
#   - Drip irrigation with partial soil wetting may reduce Kc by 10-30%; values here
#     assume well-watered full-cover conditions for maximum water demand estimation
#   - Stage durations from FAO-56 Table 11 arid climate examples
#   - Root depths are maximum effective depths; actual extraction is from upper 70%
# DATA_QUALITY: HIGH - FAO-56 is the international standard reference for crop water

column2: based on extensive global research. Values validated against Egypt

column1: #   field trials showing Â±10-20% agreement with FAO-56 baseline.

column3: Kc_end per crop); this file uses

column1: #     stage-based format (4 rows per crop with Kc progression)
#   - Toy Kc values include +5-10% arid adjustment; research values here are FAO-56 base
#   - Toy tomato Kc_mid=1.20 vs research Kc_mid=1.15 (toy has arid adjustment)
#   - Toy potato Kc_mid=1.18 vs research Kc_mid=1.15 (toy has arid adjustment)
#   - Toy onion Kc_mid=1.10 vs research Kc_mid=1.05 (toy has arid adjustment)
#   - Toy kale Kc_mid=1.10 vs research Kc_mid=1.05 (toy has arid adjustment
#   - Toy cucumber Kc_mid=1.05 vs research Kc_mid=1.00 (toy has arid adjustment)
#   - Root depths and depletion fractions are consistent between files

column7: notes
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_ini=0.6; Table 11 arid region 30 days
Linear transition Kc_ini to Kc_mid; root expansion phase
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_mid=1.15; max root depth 0.7-1.5m; p=0.40
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_end=0.70-0.90 (midpoint 0.80)
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_ini=0.5; shallow initial rooting
Linear transition Kc_ini to Kc_mid; tuber initiation begins
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_mid=1.15; max root depth 0.4-0.6m; p=0.35
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_end=0.75; vine senescence
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_ini=0.7 (dry onion); shallow roots
Linear transition; bulb initiation sensitive to water stress
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_mid=1.05; max root depth 0.3-0.6m; p=0.30
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_end=0.75 (dry); curing/drying phase
Cabbage proxy - FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_ini=0.7
Linear transition; vegetative growth phase
Cabbage proxy - FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_mid=1.05; max root 0.5-0.8m; p=0.45
Cabbage proxy - FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_end=0.95; harvest fresh
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_ini=0.5-0.6 (using 0.6)
Linear transition; vine expansion and flowering
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_mid=1.00; max root depth 0.7-1.2m; p=0.50
FAO-56 Table 12: Kc_end=0.75; fruit harvest period
